intro: Conyza graeca, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often grayish-green in color. Its small blue to purple flowers appear in clusters, and it produces numerous tiny seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Conyza graeca is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
